events.name: Afghan Women Techmakers IWD 2018 Celebration

venue.name: Park Star Hotel
venue.address_1: Park Star Hotel,Shahr - e - Naw, Ansari Square, Behind Kabul Center Yaftali Street

events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2018 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.
GDG Kabul in its first official event will hold an event to celebrate Afghan women achievements in technology and encourage them. 150 active and talented afghan women in technology will be invited. The event agenda include tech-talks, entrepreneurship talks.

events.name: Google I/O 2018 Extended Afghanistan - Live Viewing Party

venue.name: Saawis
venue.address_1: Saawis, Opp. to Aria University, Amiry Residential Town

events.description:
Google I/O Extended 2018 - Live Viewing Party Afghanistan:
What's Next from Google?

Google I/O is an annual developer-focused conference held by Google in San Francisco, California. Google I/O features highly technical, in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open web technologies.

Here, at Google I/O Extended Afghanistan we watch live stream of google I/O 18 and connect with other developers.

events.name: Building Actions on Google Assistant for Afghanistan

venue.name: NetLinks Plaza
venue.address_1: NETLINKS Plaza,Floor 1-4, Street 6, Lane 3, Phase A, Shar-e-Naw

events.description:
Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and we want to invite the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.

“Build Actions for Your Community” is an open and modular event series designed by Google and offered to community organizers worldwide.

Building Actions on Google Assistant for Afghanistan is a Google-supported event in Afghanistan to let developers learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community - whether it's a professional network, interest group, or their hometown.

• What to bring
Laptops, Notepads

Note: Event agenda and details will be updated soon.

events.name: GDG Kabul Flutter Study Jam - Part 1
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

events.name: DevFest Kabul 2018
events.description:
DevFest Kabul 2018 is the biggest Google tech conference in Afghanistan presented to you by GDG community. #DevFest2018 is not an ordinary tech conference; it is all about latest trends in technology. It is fun, inspiring and impactful.
250 developers, technology lovers, innovators, geeks and experts are meeting for a weekend on 29th November 2018 to talk, exchange and code to build tomorrow’s technologies.

More updates coming soon!

events.name: GDG Kabul Cloud Study Jam: Google Cloud Essentials

venue.name: NetLinks Plaza
venue.address_1: NETLINKS Plaza,Floor 1-4, Street 6, Lane 3, Phase A, Shar-e-Naw

events.description:
Google Cloud Platform is a set of modular cloud-based services that allow you to create anything from simple websites to complex applications.
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Google Cloud Essentials.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Fill up this form: https://goo.gl/forms/QpDE14xm37pv9xkh2

Join our meetup to become a GDG Kabul member: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Kabul/

Agenda:
1:00 PM (20 mins) - Registration
1:20 PM (10 mins) - Welcome
1:30 PM (45 mins) - Lab 1
2:15 PM (40 mins) - Lab 2
2:55 PM (25 mins) - Coffee Break
3:20 PM (40 mins) - Lab 3
4:00 PM (35 mins) - Lab 4
4:30 PM (10 mins) - Wrap up

Address: NETLINKS Plaza, Street 6, Lane 3, Phase A, Shar-e-Naw, Kabul, Afghanistan
Date: Thursday 28th Feb,2019 - 1:00 PM to 4:30 PM
Contact us at[masked] or [masked]

#CloudStudyJams | #GDGKabul

events.name: IWD WomenTechmakers Kabul 2019
events.description:
From Ada Lovelace to Grace Hopper to thousands of Googlers, we're proud of the contributions women in technology have made across the industry. And we are excited by the contributions women continue to make today. Google supports and celebrates women in technology through numerous initiatives, one of which is WomenTechmakers. A global program by Google to celebrate International Women’s Day by highlighting the talent and inspiring stories of the growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs. Women Techmakers programs provide visibility, community, and resources for women in technology globally.

This year WTM event will be held on 4th of April.

More details coming soon...

events.name: I/O Extended Kabul + Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
Save the date! GDG Kabul will host an event to recap Google I/O on 20th June 2019.

If you haven’t heard of it, Google I/O is a developer festival that was held on May 8-10 at the Shoreline Amphitheatre in Mountain View, California.

I/O brings together developers from around the globe annually for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and the firsthand look of Google’s latest developer products.

I/O Extended events are held around the world for developers to take part in the I/O experience. This year I/O extended event is going to be the biggest one featuring many amazing speakers including experts from Google. This is the opportunity to learn major Google technologies.

You can also join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. We'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Google Cloud Essentials.

Event Agenda and venue will be updated soon.

#io19
#io19ExtendedKabul

events.name: Kabul University Cloud Study Jam Challenge Program
events.description:
GDG Kabul is organizing a 5-day Event for Kabul University computer science students to help them participate in the Google Cloud Study Jam Challenge.
If you are a Kabul university student attend the event to:
✅ Validate your cloud skills & experience
✅ Access free training resources
✅ Receive a Google Home Mini
Date: From Saturday, 3rd Aug to Wednesday 7th Aug
Venue: Kabul University - Faculty of computer science
Time: 9 Am - 1 PM
Note: Please bring your own laptop.

events.name: GDG DevFest Kabul 2019
events.description:
GDG DevFest Kabul 2019 is the biggest of the year for GDG Kabul.
We create DevFest Kabul 2019 to be the best place for experience sharing in a wonderful and comfortable atmosphere.

What to expect?
- Sessions: Talks by experts on Web, Android, AI, and Cloud technologies
- Workshops: to get your hands dirty and start building things and learn new staff right there during the conference
- Showcases: Demo zones for you to display your products or explore what others have built.
-Fun and Games: You gotta have some fun.

DevFest Kabul 2019 will bring together experts in Web, Android, AI and cloud technologies from all around Afghanistan and neighboring countries.

We will post more updates very soon.

events.name: International Women's Day(IWD) 2020 by WTM Kabul
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2020 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

The event agenda includes tech-talks, workshops, lunch and a showcase of women's achievements in technology. We have invited a few of the most talented and accomplished women who have been successful in technology or as an entrepreneur to speak at the event.

All the talks will be experience-based, They will share their stories, struggles, research results and experiences with the frontier tools or technologies.

The event agenda also includes these two workshops in the afternoon, after lunch.
• Intro to AI Design + Development workshop
• Write/Code/Speak

Looking forward to meeting all you wonderful girls

events.name: Online Event: kickstart your career as a software developer with DSC
events.description:
To all the computer science students looking to become a software developer:

DSC Balkh University team in collaboration with GDG Kabul has organized this very interesting event for you.

Erica Hanson, the Developer Relations Program Manager at Google and DSC program lead, will be talking to us. She will talk about her 13 years of working at Google and she will talk to us about the opportunities that the DSC program offers for Afghan students.

Jawid Mowahed the organizer of GDG Kabul will also join this live event. He will talk about the road you have to take as a computer science student to become a software developer and the opportunities that the Google communities here in Afghanistan offer you.

Set a reminder for tonight at 10 PM.

You can watch the live stream on:
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/gdgkabul/
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtzDmJh65KpGWWhDBHZndkQ

#GDGatHome #DSCatHome #DeveloperStudentClubs

upcoming.name: Online Cloud Study Jam: Up and Running with Containers and Docker Part-1
upcoming.description:
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a suite of cloud computing services that runs on the same infrastructure that Google uses internally for its end-user products, such as Google Search, Gmail, and YouTube.

An online Cloud Study Jam is a hands-on way to learn GCP. You'll be guided by Sadiq Nasiry, a systems engineer at Moore Afghanistan. We use Qwiklabs to access the Google Cloud Platform and practice labs.

Attendees will receive a $55 credit to be used in Qwiklabs for practicing GCP quests.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want.

Join the fun. Reserve your questions and see you online!

group_profile.intro: This is Kabul's Google Developer Group (GDG). We organize events with talks and discussions about various topics around software development.

organizers.name: Sami N.
organizers.bio: GDG-Kabul Co-Organizer |  Tech Enthusiast | Software Engineer | Public Speaker
